story.title: Elliott Seeks to Split Marathon Petroleum Into Three Businesses
story.summary: PYE1M9SYF01T(Bloomberg) -- Elliott Management Corp. is urging Marathon Petroleum Corp. to split into three separate businesses, a move the hedge fund said would unlock more than $22 billion in value.Dividing Marathon into retail, midstream and refining units would create a path to address “the company’s chronic underperformance, to improve its businesses and to unlock significant and sustainable value for its shareholders,” Elliott, founded by billionaire Paul Singer, said Wednesday in a...

xmlText.p: (Bloomberg) -- Elliott Management Corp. is urging Marathon Petroleum Corp. to split into three separate businesses, a move the hedge fund said would unlock more than $22 billion in value.

Dividing Marathon into retail, midstream and refining units would create a path to address “the company’s chronic underperformance, to improve its businesses and to unlock significant and sustainable value for its shareholders,” Elliott, founded by billionaire Paul Singer, said Wednesday in a statement. The hedge fund, which said it owns 2.5% of Marathon, said it had previously engaged with the company to discuss ways to create value.
To contact the reporter on this story: Christine Buurma in New York at cbuurma1@bloomberg.net
To contact the editor responsible for this story: Simon Casey at scasey4@bloomberg.net
For more articles like this, please visit us at bloomberg.com
